parts: Identify this existential novel about stockbroker Binx Bolling's random wandering through New Orleans, Chicago, and New York.
The Moviegoer is a wok by this American novelist, who wrote about psychiatrist Bob Comeaux's attempt to control a town's cortical functions using heavy sodium doses in The Thanatos Syndrome.
This other southern novelist wrote about the whiny and annoying Edna Pontellier's disenchantment with her marriage and her life in The Awakening.

answers: Fionn MacCumhaill or Finn MaCool [accept either]
parts: Identify this leader of the Red Branch knights, a hero from Irish mythology who once burned his thumb on the Salmon of Knowledge.
Fionn's knights included this man who killed Finn's father, a battle which cost him his eye.
This lover of Grainne and member of the Red Branch knights had a magical love spot placed on his head, which would charm any woman who looked at it.

answers: perfect authentic cadence [or PAC, prompt on authentic cadence]
parts: Name these endings to a musical phrase that usually give a sense of closure to the section of the overall composition.
This specific type of cadence consists of the movement from a root position five chord to a root position one chord.
Another construct of music theory is the mode. The C Lydian mode shares the same key signature as this major key.

Identify this historical Russian opera in which the title usurper must contend with the consequences of his actions and the rebellion by a pretender to the throne. The "Farewell" scene is perhaps the most celebrated aria in all Russian opera.
Boris Godunov was written by this Russian composer, though the version normally heard today was edited heavily by Nikolai Rimsky-Korsakov

This other Godunov opera is mainly known today for its Prelude depicting dawn on the Moskova River, as well as the "Dance of the Persian Slaves." The plot concerns a rebellion by the Straltsy and Old Believers against Peter the Great.
Name the novel in which Elegant Effendi is a miniaturist who is murdered during the reign of Murad III in the Ottoman Empire.
This Turkish author wrote My Name is Red as well as the novel focusing on Ka, Snow.
Galip, the protagonist of this other novel by Pamuk searches for this missing wife and brother-in-law, Ruya and Celal, respectively. He finds both of them shot dead near Aladdin's store.

answers: Alexius I Comnenus or Alexios I Komnenos
Bohemond I of Antioch [or of Taranto]
parts: Name that Byzantine ruler whose plea for mercenaries was transformed into a passagium generale by Pope Urban II at the Council of Clermont. The history of his rule was preserved by his daughter Anna.

Alexius I is best known for ruling during this Church-sanctioned event that saw the capture of Nicaea and Jerusalem under men like Godfrey of Bouillon who had taken up the cross against Muslim "infidels."
One of the leaders of the First Crusade was this son of Robert Guiscard, who led Norman armies to capture Western Byzantine lands. As the Prince of Antioch, he would swear fealty to Alexius.

Name this "God particle" whose namesake mechanism is supposed to cause spontaneous symmetry breaking. The discovery of this last unobserved part of the Standard Model is one of the main purposes of the LHC.
The Higgs Mechanism is noted for giving this quality to particles through Nambu-Goldstone Bosons. The Compton Wavelength relates a quantum form of this quality .
Winner of the 1988 Nobel Prize for Physics for discovering the Muon, this man coined the term God Particle for the Higgs Boson with his book of the same name.
Identify this collection of thirteen piano pieces, including "From Foreign Lands and Peoples," "The Poet Speaks," and "Traumerei."

The composer of Scenes from Childhood also wrote this extremely schmaltzy setting of Heinrich Heine poems, at the end of which the speaker decides to put all his old, painful songs into a coffin and throw it into the sea.
Kinderszenen and Dichterliebe are both works by this German composer of two Liederkreis whose wife Clara premiered many of his works.
Identify this Secretary of State and leader of the Half-Breed faction of the Republican Party.

After losing an election to Grover Cleveland in 1884, James G Blaine served in the cabinet of this scandal-ridden president, who is probably more well-known for commanding the Union Army in the Civil War.
This Secretary of War under Grant was forced to resign after receiving bribes for post tradership positions. He's the only cabinet secretary to ever have been impeached.
Name this warm phase of the southern oscillation which brings warm weather and extreme flooding to south America. Its name is taken from the fact it normally happens around Christmas.
A weakening of this air flow pattern has been linked to stronger El Nino events. It is caused by the pressure gradient from the high pressure in the Eastern Pacific to low pressure in Indonesia.

El Ninos largely stop this process due to their high surface temperatures while it occurs more frequently in La Nina. This process is the wind driven flow of cold, nutrient rich water from the ocean floor to its surface
Name this tribe from the Southern Sudan.

The Nuer were extensively studied by this British anthropologist, who wrote about their religion, cosmology, and social practices in a trilogy of works. He also wrote Witchcraft, Oracles, and Magic among the Azande.
Evans-Pritchard wrote a work about kinship and this practice among the Nuer. In many cultures, this practice involves one party giving another party a small sum of money known as a dowry.
Identify this vitamin, which is the precursor of retinol and retinoic acid. This vitamin is important for vision and is the prototype of the carotenoids.

All-trans retinoic acid can trigger the expression of these important transcription factors, which contain a conserved 60 amino acid domain and are responsible for laying down the body plan of an organism.

The fact that hox gene duplications and mutations are key to understanding the phylogenetic tree is key to this field of biology, which studies the ways in which ontogeny and phylogeny are related to each other.
Name this treaty that took Russia out of World War I.

This man led the Soviet delegation to sign the Treaty of Brest-Litovsk. A potential successor to Lenin, he was outmaneuvered by Stalin and later assassinated in Mexico by an assassin wielding an ice axe.

This war was partially the result of the Soviets' conservative land claims in the Treaty of Brest-Litovsk. It was concluded at the treaty of Riga, and halted Soviet desires to spread revolution through central Europe.
Name this equation developed by a German chemist, which gives the reduction potential of a cell from the concentrations of the reductant and oxidant.

The Nernst equation is used to calculate the reduction potential of one of these components of a redox reaction. These mathematical constructs show either the oxidation or a reduction of a single species, and are then added together to give the overall "full" reaction.

The Nernst equation can be derived by considering these factors, which are the non-normalized probability of finding a system in a given state. They are normalized by one over the partition function and are equal to e to the negative beta times E sub i.

answers: Novum Organum or The (or A) New Organon
parts: Identify this work which does things like analyze the nature of heat and outlines an early theory of the scientific method.

Novum Organum was written by this philosopher, who described a society organized for scientific research in his New Atlantis and penned a classification of human knowledge, The Advancement of Learning.

Both Advancement and Novum Organum contain extended discussions of these entities, which are held to be outmoded notions and are counterposed to the "ideas" of the divine. Bacon presented a fourfold classification of these entities into those of the tribe, the cave, the marketplace, and the theatre.
Identify this artist of House at L'Estaque and Violin and Candlestick.
George Braque was a master of this art style, which featured broken perspectives and warped figures. Another prominent user of this style was the artist of Guernica, Pablo Picasso.

The cubist style can be split into an early and late one. One of these styles focused on single objects, while the later involved using collages and different textures to jam lots of things together. Name either.
Identify this Persian empire which was partly founded by the Qizilbash. This Shia empire's first ruler was Ismail I.
The Safavid empire's capital, Isfahan, was located in this modern-day country. The Zand dynasty succeeded the Safavids in this nation.
This second shah of the Safavid empire and son of Ismail I signed the Peace of Amasya with the Ottoman empire. He also ordered a massacre of the Takkalu tribe after the Uzbeks invaded Khorasan.
The Dashwood sisters are denied a fair share of inheritance because of their brother's wife Fanny in this novel.

This other character from Sense and Sensibility invites Elinor and Marianne to join her in Cleveland for Christmas. She is the younger sister of Lady Middleton and enjoys joking about her husbands impolite behavior.
In Jane Austen's other novel, Persuasion, this protagonist is dissuaded from marrying the poor Frederick Wentworth by her father Sir Walter.
Name this Norse deity served by Roskva and Thialfi, who owns a chariot pulled by two immortal goats. You may know him better for wielding the hammer Mjolnir and being the god of thunder.
Thor and the giant Hymir once went fishing for this creature, a child of Loki so large he is able to surround the whole earth. At Ragnarok, this creature and Thor will kill each other.
During one fun excursion, Thor and company slept inside one of these objects belonging to the giant Skrymir.

answers: Kingdom of Sweden or Konungariket Sverige
parts: Name this Scandanavian country separated from Finland by the Gulf of Bothnia. Its capital and largest city is built on numerous islands and has many waterways.
Karlstad is on the shores of this largest Swedish lake, which lies northwest of the country's second largest lake, the similarly named Lake Vattern.
The Oresund separates a highly populated Swedish Scanian province from this island, which is itself connected to Funen.

answers: Death in Venice [or Der Tod in Venedig]
parts: Name this Munich resident, the author of masterpieces like Maia and The Abject, as well as a prose epic about Frederick the Great.
Gustav von Aschenbach becomes obsessed with the boy Tadzio and catches cholera on his vacation in this novella by Thomas Mann.
Mann wrote a short story about this brother of Olympia, who poses nude for his godfather Maggotson and is repulsed by the pimples of the actor Muller-Rose
